p.i: The House met at half-past Two o'clock

speech.p: It may be for the convenience of the House if I indicate that, after calling all hon. Members in the Chamber to take the Oath or to affirm, I shall suspend the sitting until 5 o'clock. That will be the last occasion today. Tomorrow, I shall again be in the Chair from 2.30 pm, but I intend to finish not later than 4.30 pm.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by law:

speech.p: Resolved, That this House do now adjourn till tomorrow at half-past Two o'clock.—[Mr. Andrew MacKay.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at half-past Five o'clock.
